blood.name: Complete Blood Count (CBC)
blood.description: A comprehensive blood test that evaluates overall health and detects a variety of disorders, such as anemia, infection, and leukemia.

blood.name: Lipid Profile
blood.description: A blood test that measures the levels of lipids, including cholesterol and triglycerides, to assess cardiovascular health.

blood.name: Liver Function Test (LFT)
blood.description: A group of blood tests that provide information about the state of a patient's liver.

blood.name: Thyroid Function Test (TFT)
blood.description: A blood test that measures the levels of thyroid hormones to assess thyroid function.

urine.name: Urinalysis
urine.description: A test that examines the content of urine to detect disorders such as diabetes, kidney disease, and urinary tract infections.

urine.name: 24-Hour Urine Collection
urine.description: A test that measures the total amount of urine produced in 24 hours to assess kidney function.

urine.name: Urine Culture
urine.description: A test that detects bacteria or yeast in the urine to diagnose urinary tract infections.

stool.name: Stool Analysis
stool.description: A test that examines the stool for signs of digestive disorders, infections, and other gastrointestinal issues.

stool.name: Stool Culture
stool.description: A test that detects bacteria or parasites in the stool to diagnose infections.

stool.name: Fecal Occult Blood Test
stool.description: A test that checks for hidden blood in the stool, which can indicate gastrointestinal bleeding.

stool.name: Stool Fat Test
stool.description: A test that measures the amount of fat in the stool to diagnose malabsorption disorders.

imaging.name: X-Ray
imaging.description: A quick and painless imaging test that uses radiation to create images of the inside of the body.

imaging.name: Ultrasound
imaging.description: An imaging test that uses sound waves to create images of organs and structures inside the body.

imaging.name: CT Scan
imaging.description: A detailed imaging test that uses X-rays and computer technology to create cross-sectional images of the body.

imaging.name: MRI Scan
imaging.description: An advanced imaging test that uses magnetic fields and radio waves to create detailed images of organs and tissues.
